abstract: NBC Universal will sell its TV shows through Microsoft’s new Zune video store, but won’t sell them through Apple’s iTunes. One reason, NBC says, is that Microsoft is developing a system to block pirated videos from playing on the Zune.
snippet: NBC Universal will sell its TV shows through Microsoft’s new Zune video store, but won’t sell them through Apple’s iTunes. One reason, NBC says, is that Microsoft is developing a system to block pirated videos from playing on the Zune.
lead_paragraph: UPDATED | 10:25 PM Microsoft has posted an item on its Zune Insder blog related to this. See the end of this post.

headline.main: Microsoft May Build a Copyright Cop Into Every Zune

abstract: Since Microsoft formally pulled its bid for Yahoo over the weekend, Wall Street and Silicon Valley have been parsing every comment and reading every tea leaf in hopes of figuring out whether a deal is still possible.
lead_paragraph: Since Microsoft formally pulled its bid for Yahoo over the weekend, Wall Street and Silicon Valley have been parsing every comment and reading every tea leaf in hopes of figuring out whether a deal is still possible.

headline.main: Analysts Return to Yahoo: Bad Omen for a Deal?

abstract: The big software maker is asking computer users to add  parts to a short film, called "The Cube."
snippet: The big software maker is asking computer users to add  parts to a short film, called "The Cube."
